FuncDef:
The nat centralized-backup redirect-ip command configures a redirection IP address for centralized backup of distributed NAT.
The undo nat centralized-backup redirect-ip command restores the default configuration.
By default, the redirection IP address for centralized backup of distributed NAT is not configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the redirection IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The centralized NAT cold backup function improves the reliability of NAT devices. After a redirection route is configured, user traffic is switched to centralized NAT devices and forwarded to the specified backup CR based on the redirection IP address. If the redirection IP address carries VPN information, user traffic is forwarded to centralized NAT devices based on the IP address and VPN information.
To configure a redirection IP address for centralized backup of distributed NAT, run the nat centralized-backup redirect-ip command.
Prerequisites
The automatic switching and switchback function for centralized backup of distributed NAT has been enabled using the nat centralized-backup enable command.
Configuration Impact
If the redirection IP address for centralized backup of distributed NAT is unreachable, user traffic is discarded after being switched to centralized NAT devices.
Precautions
When the redirection IP address is set to an IP address ranging from 127.0.0.0 to 127.255.255.255 or from 224.0.0.0 to 255.255.255.255 (loopback address segment, multicast address segment, and broadcast address segment), user traffic is switched to centralized NAT devices and user packets are discarded. Therefore, exercise caution when you set the redirection IP address to be within the preceding address segments.
The redirection VPN instance name for centralized backup of distributed NAT must be the same as that configured for the centralized NAT device and CR.
This command is applicable only to the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
